item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley: How To Make Radicchio Slaw
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Make Radicchio Slaw in Dreamlight Valley
  • How to Use Radicchio Slaw in Disney Dreamlight Valley

Cooking is a key feature in Gameloft’s Disney Dreamlight Valley . The game already had over 300 recipes, and with the new Storybook Vale DLC, there are around 100 new ones for players to try. However, the game doesn’t just hand you the recipes. Instead, Dreamers have to experiment with different ingredients to figure them out on their own.

Radicchio Slaw is a new recipe in DDV added with the Storybook Vale expansion. It’s a four-star appetizer meal, which means it requires four ingredients. Below, we’re going to show you the ingredients for Radicchio Slaw in Dreamlight Valley , as well as how to get them.

How to Make Radicchio Slaw in Dreamlight Valley

Making Radicchio Slaw is very easy once you know the ingredients. This is because you don’t need to go fishing or forage for anything. All the ingredients can be bought directly from Goofy’s Stalls.

Here’s what players will need to get:

  • 1 x Cauliflower
  • 1 x Green Beans
  • 1 x Radish
  • 1 x Radicchio.

How to Get Cauliflower in DDV

Cauliflower can be purchased from Goofy’s Stall in The Bind area of Storybook Vale. It’s sold as seeds, and each seed costs 10 Star Coins. After unlocking Goofy’s Stall in Storybook Vale as a part of the A New Chapter quest, you’ll need to upgrade it once to unlock this vegetable ingredient. And yes, it’ll take 10 minutes for its seeds to grow.

How to Get Green Beans and Radish

Players can get Green Beans and Radish from Goofy’s Stall in the Everafter biome. However, unlike The Bind, unlocking Everafter requires you to spend 2,000 Story Magic. After unlocking the area, make your way to Goofy’s Stall and upgrade it twice. The second upgrade will cost you 12,000 Star Coins, and one Green Bean Seed will cost you 250 Star Coins. Once planted, it will take four hours for its seeds to grow.

Radish, on the other hand, will be available when you repair the stall. Its seeds can be purchased for 100 Star Coins, and they take one hour and 45 minutes to fully grow.

How to Get Radicchio

DDV players can buy Radicchio seeds from Mythopia’s Goofy Stall. They’re available for 50 Star Coins each, and growing them will take you one hour and 54 minutes.

How to Use Radicchio Slaw in Disney Dreamlight Valley

After making Radicchio Slaw, players can use it in a couple of ways. You can eat Radicchio Slaw to get 835 energy points . If you don’t want to eat it, you can also sell it for 739 Star Coins .

item.title: Infinity Nikki: 11 Best 4-Star Outfits, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Obtain crucial 4-star outfits like Fully Charged and Symphony of Strings early on to advance in quests.
  • Craft Ability Outfits like Rippling Serenity to gather rare items and complete challenging quests.
  • Focus on outfits like Scaly Dream and Moonlight Oath to excel in Styling Challenges and story progression.

In Infinity Nikki , picking up stylish outfits is a central theme while players make their way around the vast open world. From unlocking the Ability Outfits that are central to completing quests to finding the best options to win Styling Challenges, players have their work cut out for them.

Many of these outfits are 4-star ensembles, and some offer better perks than others. It's important that Nikki is always dressed for success so that she can win every challenge she takes on. In addition, having the right outfits on hand will ensure she can complete crucial quests to advance the story and collect every Whimstar. These 4-star outfits are the cream of the crop, and players should focus on unlocking them as soon as possible.

11 Symphony Of Strings

The Violin Playing Ability

  • Elegant: 763–4734
  • Sweet: 1474–9142
  • Cool: 209–1299
  • Fresh: 188–1170
  • Sexy: 172–1068

The Symphony of Strings Ability Outfit is obtainable during Chapter 4, and grants Nikki the ability to play the violin. While it doesn't seem like a very useful skill, it will be required to advance the story. In addition, it's quite stylish. When fully maxed out, this outfit has a solid Sweet stat of 9142.

This outfit also has one evolution, which will transform it into Symphony of Strings: Woods. As the name suggests, it offers outdoorsy vibes with its brown and green colors. It's not the greatest outfit Nikki will own, but since it's required to complete certain quests, it's an essential 4-star outfit.

10 Fully Charged

Become An Electrician

  • Elegant: 219–1361
  • Sweet: 203–1261
  • Cool: 1524–9452
  • Fresh: 779–4833
  • Sexy: 240–1490

In Chapter 1, Florawish will experience a serious power outage, requiring the assistance of an electrician. Luckily, Nikki is prepared to handle the situation by crafting the Fully Charged Ability Outfit. This outfit will come in handy several times following this portion of the story, making it important to craft.

This outfit can be evolved into Fully Charged: Refreshing. This evolution of the outfit adds more style with striking colors. The Fully Charged Ability Outfit is essential for anyone who wants to get beyond Chapter 1 and also complete as many side quests as possible. Its style is Cool, and its label is Uniform.

9 Rippling Serenity

Make Nikki An Expert Fisher

  • Elegant: 218-1355
  • Sweet: 662-4108
  • Cool: 1671-10363
  • Fresh: 230-1429
  • Sexy: 246-1528

Some outfits require crafting supplies that can only be obtained by fishing. In addition, some Whimstars are only accessible from the depths of the waterways. Nikki's solution is Rippling Serenity. This Ability Outfit transforms Nikki into an expert fisher. She'll have all the supplies she needs to get those hard-to-reach Whimstars.

The sketch for this outfit is unlocked during Chapter 1 and is required to progress the main story. Players will find it essential moving forward. When evolved, it becomes Rippling Serenity: Dream , taking on deep blue tones. This outfit's style is Cool, and it's labeled as Romance. When fully upgraded, it has a Cool rating of 10363, which can help Nikki through some early Styling Challenges.

8 Afternoon Shine

Capture All The Bugs

  • Elegant: 208–1293
  • Sweet: 1477–9161
  • Cool: 733–4539
  • Fresh: 178–1105
  • Sexy: 210–1304

As part of the main story quest in Chapter 1, Nikki will need to catch a Foodie Bee. This quest unlocks the ability to acquire the sketch for Afternoon Shine in the Heart of Infinity. She'll continue to need this ability to gather crafting materials and complete additional quests, making it a crucial addition to her wardrobe.

This outfit falls under the Sweet style with an Adventure label. It can be evolved into Afternoon Shine: Rain, which trades the bright yellow of the original for a darker combination reminiscent of an incoming storm. It boasts a decent Sweet rating when fully upgraded.

7 Bye-Bye Dust

Adopt The Grooming Ability

  • Elegant: 693–4289
  • Sweet: 1392–8646
  • Cool: 189–1176
  • Fresh: 190–1180
  • Sexy: 173–1076

Bye-Bye Dust is an Ability Outfit that's unlocked during Chapter 1. It's required to advance the main story and is acquired during the "In the Land of Wishes" quest. Once that quest is over, players will find themselves using this ability to collect various materials from different animals around Miraland.

This outfit can be evolved into Bye-Bye Dust: Kitty, which gives it a more feline appearance with black and white patches. Bye-Bye Dust's style is Sweet and its label is Playful.

6 Starlet Burst

Shrink On Demand

  • Elegant: 189–1174
  • Sweet: 1557–9656
  • Cool: 232–1442
  • Fresh: 226–1405
  • Sexy: 765–4746

For anyone who ever wanted to hitch a ride on Momo, this Ability Outfit is the key. Starlet Burst allows Nikki to shrink on demand. Unfortunately, players will have to wait to obtain this outfit, as it doesn't unlock until Chapter 6. It's acquired during the quest "Mysterious Wishing Woods."

Starlet Burst can evolve into Starlet Burst: Glow. In the evolved version, the ensemble changes from a blue theme to a golden one. This Ability Outfit has a Sweet Style with a Fantasy label.

5 Scaly Dream

An Outfit Of Infinite Cool

  • Elegant: 963–5976
  • Sweet: 243–1510
  • Cool: 1962–12169
  • Fresh: 264–1640
  • Sexy: 284–1764

When Styling Challenges come up, players need to be on their A-game. Scaly Dream can help knock out the competition when it comes to delivering a Cool outfit. While this isn't an Ability Outfit, it can help Nikki win some challenges when it's fully upgraded. When it's maxed out, its Cool stat is a whopping 12169.

It can be evolved into Scaly Dream: Icy Depths. Where the original outfit has a black theme, the evolved version takes on an icy blue hue. Scaly Dream must be purchased from the premium store and is not always available. It has a Cool style and a Linlang label.

4 Moonlight Oath

An Outfit Of Pure Elegance

  • Elegant: 2661–16503
  • Sweet: 376–2335
  • Cool: 368–2287
  • Fresh: 369–2291
  • Sexy: 341–2119

Moonlight Oath can only be purchased from the premium store, and it's not always available. For players lucky enough to pick up this ensemble, there's a strong chance they can wreck the competition during a Styling Challenge that calls for an Elegant piece. When this outfit is fully upgraded, it comes in at 16503 for Elegant.

Its original color scheme is a vibrant blue. When it evolves, it becomes Moonlight Oath: Woods and takes on a purple tone. This outfit's style is Elegant, and its label is Fantasy.

3 Wind Of Purity

Purify The Dark Essence

  • Elegant: 1502–9318
  • Sweet: 223–1385
  • Cool: 207–1287
  • Fresh: 749–4646
  • Sexy: 232–1440

Obtained through the natural progression of the story early in Nikki's journey, players will find Wind of Purity to be one of the most essential outfits they own. This Ability Outfit will allow them to purify Dark Essence. Players will have no problem knocking out any Esselings that get in their way. They'll also be able to collect every Dew of Inspiration they come across.

Wind of Purity can evolve into Wind of Purity: Dawn. The original version is a light green, while the evolved version takes on a blue tone. This Ability Outfit has an Elegant style with a Romance label.

2 Bubbly Voyage

Jump And Float

  • Elegant: 205–1273
  • Sweet: 1531–9496
  • Cool: 231–1436
  • Fresh: 770–4777
  • Sexy: 236–1466

During the prologue, Nikki finds herself in a bit of a bind, needing to jump and cross a distance. Luckily, she finds some inspiration to craft Bubbly Voyage, an Ability Outfit that allows her to jump and float. Once players craft this outfit, they will use it nonstop, making it one of the most important ones they will possess throughout Nikki's journey.

When Nikki first crafts this outfit, it will be a shiny, dark blue. It can evolve into Bubbly Voyage: Spring , at which time it will change color to a vibrant spring green. This outfit has a Sweet style with a Summer label.

1 Floral Memory

Glide Long Distances

  • Elegant: 777–4820
  • Sweet: 215–1336
  • Cool: 214–1329
  • Fresh: 1536–9527
  • Sexy: 230–1430

Floral Memory is an Ability Outfit that's unlocked during Chapter 3. It's needed to progress the main story and allows Nikki to glide long distances from high places. With this outfit, she can travel even further than ever. It's a beautiful outfit with a lighter top half and a blue bottom with flowers.

When it evolves, it becomes Floral Memory: Gleam , and the color scheme changes to brown with fruits instead of flowers. This Ability Outfit has a Fresh style with a Retro label.

item.title: 5 JRPGs Where You Cannot Become Overpowered
item.description:
Summary

  • RPGs empower players through traditional leveling and equipment acquisition, providing a sense of accomplishment.
  • Level scaling in some RPGs prevents players from becoming overpowered, ensuring a challenging experience.
  • Some RPGs, like Fire Emblem, require strict progression, limiting player freedom and making it hard to feel powerful.

One great reason to play an RPG is to feel empowered. With traditional leveling-up systems, players can increase their stats. Once they get above an enemy’s level, they can crush them easily, giving players a sense of accomplishment through perseverance. Getting equipment can be another way players can get stronger in an RPG.

Some RPGs don’t allow players to get ahead of anyone else though for various reasons. One of them is called level-scaling which makes sure players are always near an enemy’s level in a given area. That’s one example of why players can’t get overpowered in an RPG but there are other examples too as shown below.

5 Dragon Quest Builders

Restarting From Scratch

This Dragon Quest spinoff was an action game with mechanics that Minecraft fans would love and even though Dragon Quest Builders copied the gimmick, it executed it well with one caveat. When players got to a zone, they could level up by defeating enemies, getting materials, crafting things, and so on.

When that chapter is complete, levels will reset and the first time that happens to a newcomer they will probably drop their jaw to the floor. This problem was fixed in the sequel making it a smoother experience but this original is still fun despite the lack of power.

4 Final Fantasy: Crystal Chronicles

Dungeon-based Progression

There are a few challenging Final Fantasy games thanks to level scaling like Final Fantasy 8 and Final Fantasy Tactics . Among all of the spinoffs and mainline games though, Final Fantasy: Crystal Chronicles is the hardest to feel powerful in but not the most difficult overall.

Players could create a character and Job and then set out alone or with a party of three other players locally on the GameCube. In dungeons, players could equip weapons and magic but when that dungeon was complete, things would reset. It was hard to feel like an epic adventurer when the progression system was flawed in this way.

3 Fire Emblem

Die, Reload, And Try Again

Any entry before Fire Emblem Awakening would work for this entry because it is incredibly hard to become powerful throughout most of Fire Emblem’s history. Fire Emblem was the seventh main game but the first in North America. What set it apart from other grid-based tactical RPGs was the difficulty and linearity. Also, there was permadeath meaning that important characters could die in battle.

The only way to level up was through a strict series of battles, so anyone who didn’t get EXP was out of luck. There was no way to grind and get stronger and losing an ally was almost like losing a finger in real life. That’s why save scumming became so popular in the series up until the aforementioned Fire Emblem Awakening which gave players an option to turn off permadeath and other quality-of-life improvements as a way to enjoy side content.

2 Mario & Luigi: Brothership

Draining On Plumbers

Mario & Luigi: Brothership is the latest entry in the Mario & Luigi RPG series. Gameplay remains mostly the same from the previous entries as players can control Mario and Luigi in turn-based battles with active engagement. Hitting the jump button during an attack will do more damage and players can counter enemies on their turn too.

As great as it was to get the series back again, some setbacks sent some fans reeling back. This game requires heavy grinding for EXP unlike any entry in the series prior and enemies typically scale to the plumbers too. It can be exhausting in more ways than one.

1 Monster Hunter: World

The World Is Not Your Oyster

All of the Monster Hunter games are wildly challenging but Monster Hunter: World stands out just because it helped change the series for the better. The menu system was tweaked, it was easier to get into multiplayer, the areas were more open, weapons felt better to use, and so on.

Despite that, the one thing Capcom didn’t change was the progression system. Players “level up” by getting better gear through skinning monsters. However, even after getting some of the best loot in the game, some beginner monsters can still lay players to waste like they were nothing and the limitations on deaths during a mission don’t help players feel any better either.

item.title: Fortnite May Never Bring Back These Fan Favorite Skins
item.description:
Summary

  • Fortnite Arcane skins may never return to the game, as Riot initially only pursued them to promote the first season of its popular Netflix show.
  • Nevertheless, Riot is now reportedly looking into the possibility of bringing them back to Fortnite, but it's still unclear how likely that is to actually happen.

The Fortnite Arcane skins may never be coming back to the popular game, a senior Riot Games official has reportedly revealed. However, Fortnite fans wanting to see these cosmetics return shouldn't lose all hope just yet.

Fortnite 's Arcane: League of Legends -themed Set consists of Jinx and Vi skins, as well as ten matching cosmetics. Jinx was released near the end of Chapter 2: Season 8 in November 2021, coinciding with the premiere of Netflix's immensely popular animated series. Vi then during Chapter 3: Season 1 in January of the following year. While both cosmetics were well-received, Jinx stands out as being one of the most popular releases from Fortnite 's Gaming Legends Series to date. Neither skin has returned to the game after being pulled in early February 2022.

Long-time Fortnite leaker ShiinaBR has recently taken to Twitter to reveal that the Arcane skins aren't likely to ever return to the game, citing an unnamed Riot Games co-founder, which would be either Brandon Beck or Marc Merrill. One of them reportedly suggested that the skins were offered for an extremely limited period by design, as their inclusion in the Item Shop was solely motivated by the launch of Arcane Season 1. While the show was recently treated to its second and final season, released in three parts throughout November 2024, it's unclear whether the thought of bringing the skins back for this occasion even crossed Riot's mind.

Riot Reportedly Looking Into Bringing Back Fortnite Arcane Skins

Be that as it may, the League of Legends developer is now said to have been made fully aware of just how many players would like to see Fortnite 's Arcane skins back in the in-game shop. After ShiinaBR's original report made the rounds on social media, the same Riot official reportedly promised to talk with the LoL team about the possibility of arranging a rerun for the cosmetics.

While a potential return of the Arcane Set wouldn't solely be up to Riot, Epic Games presumably wouldn't be too opposed to granting Jinx and Vi another stint in the Item Shop. Nevertheless, given that licensing negotiations necessary for bringing any IP to Fortnite can take months, League of Legends fans shouldn't hold their breath for the Arcane protagonists to return to the battle royale game.

Regardless of whether the original Arcane Set makes its way back to the Item Shop, Riot and Epic might have some new opportunities to collaborate in the foreseeable future. Riot co-founder Marc Merrill recently confirmed that even more League of Legends shows are on the way, all of which would ostensibly benefit from high-profile crossovers in the vein of Fortnite cosmetics.

item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley: How to Get Posidonia
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Get Posidonia in Disney Dreamlight Valley
  • How to Use Posidonia in Dreamlight Valley

Disney Dreamlight Valley’s second expansion, Storybook Vale, has introduced fans to the massive world of Storybook Vale. This world has three magical biomes with individually unlocked areas and many new items and fish. But not everything you reel in is a fish. You can also fish up some items like Posidonia, which can be used for crafting, kind of like Plastic Scrap from A Rift in Time.

There’s not much you can do with Posidonia in Dreamlight Valley since it’s only used in a few crafting recipes. However, players will need it to complete some early quests in Storybook Vale. So, it’s good to know where to find it, and that’s exactly what this guide will show you.

How to Get Posidonia in Disney Dreamlight Valley

Getting Posidonia is pretty easy once you know its location. First, head over to the Mythopia biome and find a water body. To catch it, fans will need to fish in spots without bubbles . Make sure to avoid casting your line in blue, white, or golden ripples since those will give you fish like Hippocampus and Stygian Mudskipper.

While fishing for Posidonia, you might end up catching some Flying Fish too, as they’re also found in non-bubble spots in Mythopia. Don’t worry, though, because you will still reel in plenty of Posidonia along the way. If you like decorating your valley, it would be a good idea to collect a large amount of Posidonia since it’s super easy to get.

Furthermore, make sure to bring a fishing buddy. They can give you extra Posidonia whenever you catch one. Just talk to a character and pick the ‘Let’s hang out’ option. If you don’t see that option, it might be because their friendship level isn’t at least level two, so work on that first.

How to Use Posidonia in Dreamlight Valley

Players will need Posidonia to complete some quests in Dreamlight Valley . For example, it’s used to make Flower Extract during Flynn Rider’s An Old-Fashioned Heist quest, and you’ll also need to give five pieces to Hades for his Mythic Restoration friendship quest.

Here are the materials required to make Flower Extract:

  • 2 x White Rose
  • 2 x Olive Green Tale Cone Flowers
  • 2 x Honeydew Melons
  • 8 x Posidonia.

In addition to Flower Extract, fans can use Posidonia to craft a bunch of furniture and decorative items. Some examples of these items include:

  • Green Bind L Couch
  • Lilo’s Bunk Bed
  • Orange Bind L Couch
  • The Bind Fountain.
